Package Controllers

Class customerScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controllers.customerScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class customerScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class handles creating, reading, updating, and deleting customers.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This initializes the page by running the generateCustomersTable and loadCountryBox methods.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        rb -

      • generateCustomersTable

        private void generateCustomersTable()
        This method handles filling the customer tableview with customer data. Users can select dustomers in order to modify or delete them, or use their data as a template for creating a new customer in the database.

        This method features a Lambda function that adds a listener to the tableview so that when a user clicks on a customer, the text and combo boxes are filled out using that customer's data.

      • loadCountryBox

        private void loadCountryBox()
        This handles loading the country box from the Data model

      • selectDivision

        private void selectDivision()
        This handles filtering the options available in the division box through a filtered stream

      • clearFields

        private void clearFields()
        This method handles clearing out the text and combo boxes. It was necessary to separate it out from the clearButton as there are other actions which require the fields to clear.

      • returnToMain

        private void returnToMain​(javafx.event.Event event)
        This handles returning to the main page. I made it separate in case there were any actions other than clicking the cancel button that would require sending the user back to main.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • cancelButton

        private void cancelButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This allows the user of the program to leave the customer screen
        Parameters:
        event -

      • createButton

        private void createButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This method first checks that all of the boxes are filled, except for the customerID box, then passes those values to the CustomerDAO.createCustomer which creates the customer in the database. It then calls the Data.generateCustomers method to refresh the Data object and refreshes the tableview.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • updateButton

        private void updateButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This updates the selected customer after verifying that all the fields and boxes have values. Once it's validated, it calls the CustomerDAO.updateCustomer with the values, then calls Data.generateCustomers and refreshes the tableview.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • clearButton

        private void clearButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This allows the user to clear all the fields and tableview selection
        Parameters:
        event -

      • deleteButton

        private void deleteButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        This allows the user to delete a customer. It first finds all the appointments by that customer and presents a confirmation box asking the user if they want to delete those appointments and that customer. If the user answers in the affirmative, the method then loops through all the appointments by the customer and calls deleteAppointment on each, then it deletes the customer. Finally, it refreshes the Data object's appointment and customer lists before refreshing the tableview.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
